H0.text: Disaronno is an 'amaretto' liqueur with a characteristic bitter-almond taste, however it doesn't contain any nuts at all; from the kernel of which fruit does the flavour come. Apricot

H1.text: Disaronno is an 'amaretto' liqueur with a characteristic bitter-almond taste, however it doesn't contain any nuts at all; from the kernel of which fruit does the flavour come. Cherry

H2.text: Disaronno is an 'amaretto' liqueur with a characteristic bitter-almond taste, however it doesn't contain any nuts at all; from the kernel of which fruit does the flavour come. Plum

H3.text: Disaronno is an 'amaretto' liqueur with a characteristic bitter-almond taste, however it doesn't contain any nuts at all; from the kernel of which fruit does the flavour come. Xìng

A4.text: Apricot kernel oil gives Disaronno and some other types of amaretto their almond-like flavor.

A5.text: In Mandarin Chinese, the term xìngrén (杏仁) can refer to either apricot kernels or almonds.

A6.text: Disaronno Originale does not actually contain almonds.

A7.text: The liqueur is an infusion of apricot kernel oil.
